image.altText: Volodymyr Zelenskyy and Donald Trump speak to one another.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump says he's had a "very good" phone call with Volodymyr Zelenskyy — their first conversation since the US president publicly scolded his Ukrainian counterpart and ordered him out of the White House three weeks ago.

title.children: Trump, Zelenskyy have 'very good' first call since White House blow-up

image.altText: Chimneys from Scarborough's Pluto gas facility with flames coming from them.

props.synopsis: Gas consumption in Australia is falling faster than anticipated, helping to avoid the risks of seasonal shortages in the next few years, according to energy commentators.

title.children: Looming gas crisis averted as Australian use plummets

image.altText: A small bowl of plain elbow pasta next to a red squeeze bottle.

props.synopsis: Parents say they are being lied to about the quality of food at childcare centres across the country. Some say they were promised in-house chefs but children were served "two-minute noodles".

title.children: 'We don't actually serve that': Parents lied to about childcare food standards

image.altText: A screenshot of a video posted to RedNote shows Peter Dutton and the words "Dutton will not use Aboriginal flag".

props.synopsis: A series of attacks on Australian political parties on emerging Chinese social media platform RedNote raise concerns about misinformation, disinformation and the risk of foreign interference ahead of the federal election.

title.children: Deepfake Peter Dutton speaking Mandarin spotlights misinformation threat

image.altText: Sign for the Australian National University (ANU) in Canberra.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump's "America First" agenda hits Australian universities, with at least six reporting funding cuts or pauses under the new administration.

title.children: Australian unis losing US funding amid Trump's 'America First' agenda

image.altText: A young Israeli man with dark hair and wearing a green shirt standing among protesters in a street.

props.synopsis: The Israeli prime minister is facing fierce protests over his decision to launch fresh strikes in Gaza, shattering the ceasefire in the strip.

title.children: Thousands march on Netanyahu's home after latest Gaza strikes

image.altText: A close shot of Health Minister Mark Butler's face, looking serious.

props.synopsis: Health Minister Mark Butler says the government is lobbying the White House to not impose tariffs on Australian pharmaceuticals as he guarantees there will be no change to the PBS. Follow live.

title.children: Govt says 'no change' to PBS as Trump lobbied to impose tariffs

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: No plans to fast-track PBS changes: Butler
Coalition demands PM meets Trump face-to-face
Labor to slash cost of prescription medication

image.altText: A close-up of Jim Chalmers's face.

props.synopsis: If two ongoing wars weren't enough uncertainty into which to deliver a federal budget, there's the precariousness of the Trump administration's trade agenda.

title.children: Both sides of politics are playing it safe as the spectre of increasing uncertainty looms

props.synopsis: Reducing the time people spend job hunting has a broader economic benefit, with an independent report finding one charity helping women into the workforce has generated $86 million in net direct economic benefits over the past 20 years.

title.children: How helping women into the workforce is worth millions to the economy

image.altText: A teenage boy holding a plank of wood like a rifle in his kitchen while wearing a yellow bucket hat.

props.synopsis: The court heard that Nicholas Prosper had withdrawn into an online world and illegally bought a firearm as he plotted to carry out an attack on a primary school north of London.

title.children: British teen who murdered mother, brother and sister jailed for 49 years

image.altText: SpaceX dragon capsule entering the earth's atmosphere

props.synopsis: After 268 days without fresh air or a proper shower, Butch Wilmore and Sunita Williams made their final journey back to Earth.

title.children: Inside the mission that brought NASA's 'stranded' astronauts home

image.altText: Antibiotics spread out on a table.

props.synopsis: As US big pharma comes for Australia's PBS, Labor is promising even cheaper medicines.

title.children: PBS medication to cost no more than $25 under Labor re-election pitch

image.altText: An ASX board with ASX in focus and stock prices out of focus.

props.synopsis: The Australian share market is expected to extend gains on Thursday after Wall Street stocks rallied on the Fed Reserve's forecast rate cuts. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX set to gain as Wall Street rallies on Fed Reserve rate cut forecast

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: US Fed Reserve holds rates, but forecasts 50 basis points cut this year

image.altText: A surveillance camera is silhouetted behind a Chinese national flag in Beijing.

props.synopsis: Beijing's spy agency said the man reportedly passed on information to an unnamed foreign power.

title.children: China sentences ex-engineer to death for alleged spying

image.altText: DRC Congo mining

props.synopsis: In the Democratic Republic of the Congo, battles are taking place for territory and rare earth minerals such as cobalt. Donald Trump is about to enter the race.

title.children: Is the Democratic Republic of the Congo next for Trump?

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

props.synopsis:
Buying a carton of eggs at your local supermarket has become a lot harder in the past year.

The shelves are often bare, there's a limit on the number of cartons you can take home and prices are rising.

Today, Landline reporter Tim Lee explains how bird flu is leading to a major egg shortage and why it could last for years.

Featured:

Tim Lee, Landline reporter

title.children: How long will the egg shortage last?

image.altText: A man wearing a suit and red tie giving a speech outside a courthouse.

props.synopsis: Opposition figures and the foreign ministries of multiple countries have expressed alarm at a series of arrests, as members of Recep Tayyip Erdoğan's government reject allegations they are conducting a "coup".

title.children: Main rival to Türkiye's Erdoğan arrested just before presidential run

image.altText: Peter Dutton speaks at a press conference at parliament house

props.synopsis: The opposition leader put his team on notice. He vowed he would remember the name of anyone who freelanced on policies. A month on, there's one name on the list of offenders — Peter Dutton.

title.children: Dutton won't need help identifying MP breaking his pre-election edict

image.altText: A couple stand behind a flock of brown hens, with green grass and clouds in the sky.

props.synopsis: After 12 months of empty egg shelves in supermarkets, thousands of people across Australia are looking for ways around the shortages.

title.children: Thousands of backyards turn into homegrown chook farms amid egg shortage

image.altText: A girl in a blach shirt sits next to a grave with photos of a young girl on it and a white cross, in a field.

props.synopsis: Family and friends of a Sydney woman who passed away in 2022 are challenging the cemetery she is buried in over their no ornamentation rules.

title.children: 'Let us grieve in peace': Sydney cemetery's no ornaments rule upsets family

image.altText: High up view of crowds and an open top car with a man in a suit and a woman in a pink outfit sitting in the back seat

props.synopsis: Conspiracy theories, new timelines and suspicions of KGB links were among the 80,000 pages of documents, many blurred and damaged by age.

title.children: New JFK files reveal assassin's trip to Soviet embassy before attack

image.altText: A dog is silhouetted running alongside a side-by-side in a picturesque landscape with green trees and rolling hills.

props.synopsis: Newly released safety statistics show side-by-side vehicles were involved in 14 deaths on Australian farms in 2024 despite being fitted with seatbelts and rollover protection cages.

title.children: Vehicle touted as safer than quad bikes now leading killer on farms

image.altText: Multiple packets of colourful pharmaceutical medicines.

props.synopsis: American medical giants want tariffs imposed on Australia as punishment for its Pharmaceutical Benefits Scheme, which sees the government negotiate cheaper prices for medicines for Australians

title.children: US pharmaceutical giants urge Trump to put further tariffs on Australia

image.altText: Tassie Devils unveil their new mascot, Rum'un 2025-03-18 11:03:00

props.synopsis: He's a little ugly and rough as guts. Perfectly imperfect, laughed at and misunderstood by those across the strait. And what could be more Tasmanian than that? Meet Rum'un, the Devils' new mascot.

title.children: Who, or what, is Rum'un, Tasmania's new AFL mascot?

image.altText: A blonde woman faces a press pack

props.synopsis: Keli Lane, the woman convicted of killing her baby daughter in one of Australia's most notorious criminal cases, has been identified in NSW parliament as a victim of convicted sex offender and former prison officer Wayne Gregory Astill.

title.children: Convicted baby killer Keli Lane named as victim of former prison officer

image.altText: A perch fish underwater.

props.synopsis: Without the help, native freshwater fish like bream, pike and bass can become backed up behind the lock and form easy prey for predators in the spring, when the lock is rarely opened for passing boats.

title.children: How a 'doorbell' is helping migrating fish in the Netherlands

image.altText: A picture of burnt out cars

props.synopsis: A Tesla service centre in Las Vegas has become the latest target in a series of attacks against the car maker, with the FBI blasting them as "unacceptable".

title.children: There's been an attack on Teslas. The FBI says it has 'hallmarks' of terrorism

image.altText: A sign on the front of a building saying 'Genius Childcare', photographed through bars.

props.synopsis: Administrators have taken control of the majority of childcare centres run by teetering empire Genius.

title.children: Administrators take control over most of national childcare chain's centres

image.altText: murder victim Lilie James in a car wearing a yellow top smiles as she takes a selfie

props.synopsis: Lilie James was smiling and talking to her killer moments before her death with "no indication" of what he was going to do, an inquest has heard.

title.children: CCTV of Lilie James moments before her murder 'not easy to watch'

image.altText: Eight books, including a picture book, and a manuscript arranged against a while wall and yellow floor.

props.synopsis: The winners of this year's Victorian Premier's Literary Awards have been announced, with the list dominated by independent presses and First Nations writers.

title.children: Growing up, Wanda got old dresses for Xmas. Her book about it just won $125k

image.altText: Detective Sargeant Chris Watson

props.synopsis: For the first time, the lead police investigator on the case is speaking about how they found those responsible for the death of Glenn Walewicz.

title.children: 'Shot dead by a complete stranger': How police cracked the case
